text: The addition of rCTLA4Ig , which blocks <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binding to its ligand , to the cultures decreased <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter activation by > 80 % .

text: Interestingly , CTLA4Ig did not significantly inhibit the activation of either NF of activated T cells ( NFAT ) or AP-1 reporters .
Therefore , activation of NFAT and AP-1 is insufficient for <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter activation .
event: <extra_id_0> <extra_id_0> Positive_regulation insufficient <extra_id_0> Theme activation <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Positive_regulation activation <extra_id_0> Theme IL-2 <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1>

text: In contrast , an RE / AP reporter was blocked by CTLA4Ig by > 90 % .

Thus , the requirement for <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter activation appears to be due to RE / AP and not the NFAT or AP-1 sites .

text: In addition , these data suggest that transcriptional activation of RE / AP is not mediated by NFAT , because activation of a NFAT reporter is not affected by the addition of CTLA4Ig .
